description: InfraAssessmentReport is a specification for the InfraAssessmentReport resource.

apiVersion.description:
APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object.
Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and
may reject unrecognized values.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description:
Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents.
Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to.
Cannot be updated.
In CamelCase.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

checks.description: Checks provides results of conducting audit steps.

items.description: Check provides the result of conducting a single audit step.

remediation.description: Remediation provides description or links to external resources to remediate failing check.

scope.description: Scope indicates the section of config that was audited.

type.description: Type indicates type of this scope, e.g. Container, ConfigMapKey or JSONPath.

value.description: Value indicates value of this scope that depends on Type, e.g. container name, ConfigMap key or JSONPath expression

severity.description: Severity level of a vulnerability or a configuration audit check.

scanner.description: Scanner is the spec for a scanner generating a security assessment report.

name.description: Name the name of the scanner.

vendor.description: Vendor the name of the vendor providing the scanner.

version.description: Version the version of the scanner.

summary.description: InfraAssessmentSummary counts failed checks by severity.

criticalCount.description: CriticalCount is the number of failed checks with critical severity.

highCount.description: HighCount is the number of failed checks with high severity.

lowCount.description: LowCount is the number of failed check with low severity.

mediumCount.description: MediumCount is the number of failed checks with medium severity.
